name: transcendently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is greater, better, more important, or going past or above all others: She has done some transcendently stupid things in the course of her life. No other violin can match the transcendently beautiful sound of a Stradivarius.
More examplesFewer examplesI pictured the island as a transcendently beautiful place.I found their recent performance of "Madame Butterfly" to be a transcendently moving experience.That was the most transcendently brilliant acoustic guitar performance that I have ever witnessed.
